title: Iran's bloody and concealed crackdown
subhead: Iran's regime, which has cut off internet access across the country, has now labeled protesters as 'terrorist agents' and claimed they were paid by Israel and the United States.

title: Mexico's president downplays Trump's threats
US oil majors show only moderate enthusiasm for Venezuelan oil, despite Trump's urging
EU-Mercosur agreement: Five key questions about where things stand
subhead: The commercial agreement is set to be officially signed on Monday after France failed to block its adoption. However, doubts remain about whether it will actually come into effect.

title: What the US withdrawal from international bodies means for climate change and biodiversity
subhead: The US's exit from the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change, the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change and its equivalent for biodiversity threatens to further slow and hinder the fight against environmental crises.

title: Venezuela says in talks with US to restore diplomatic ties
subhead: The government of the South American country's interim President Delcy Rodriguez 'has decided to initiate an exploratory diplomatic process' with the US government, 'aimed at re-establishing diplomatic missions in both countries,' Foreign Minister Yvan Gil said in a statement.

title: 'Don't forget you saved my life': Letter to the stranger who gave me their bone marrow
subhead: Hélène Schlesinger was 37 and had a husband, two children, and plenty of plans for the future when she learned, in 2022, that she had leukemia. For months, the young woman fought as she waited for a bone marrow transplant. She lives thanks to an anonymous donor. All she knows is that he is German and that a part of him now lives inside her.

'In Iran, the conditions that enabled the American operation in Venezuela are not present'
subhead: Political analyst Hamzeh Safavi, whose father is an adviser to Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei, discusses the abduction of Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro by the US on January 3 in Caracas, and its impact on the Islamic Republic.

title: 'Christopher Columbus embodying Trump and Meloni's supremacist fantasies is no coincidence'
subhead: 'Debated Figures' (1/5). Once praised by French traditionalist Catholics, the 'discoverer of America' is now celebrated by American and Italian leaders, writes historian Romain Bertrand.

title: 'The raw and brutal display of American power in the Trump II era is finally opening the eyes of Washington's allies'
subhead: Europe finds itself in a perilous phase, having recognized its solitude but lacking the means for true autonomy, while the emotion created by the aggressiveness of empires calls for a response, writes Le Monde columnist Sylvie Kauffmann.

title: France's narrow path toward a budget
